body_html:
I'm using the Tensorflow 13.3.1 CPU version from source, with Python 3.5.3 x86_64, Ubuntu 17 and 16GB of memory. I compiled from source after getting this error using the default pip version of Tensorflow.

I'm running the example here:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/mnist/mnist_deep.py

accuracy.eval(...) is throwing the following error when computing accuracy against the MNIST test set on line 167:

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::bad_alloc'
what(): std::bad_alloc

body:
I'm using the Tensorflow 13.3.1 CPU version from source, with Python 3.5.3 x86_64, Ubuntu 17 and 16GB of memory. I compiled from source after getting this error using the default pip version of Tensorflow.

I'm running the example here:

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/tutorials/mnist/mnist_deep.py

accuracy.eval(...) is throwing the following error when computing accuracy against the MNIST test set on line 167:

terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::bad_alloc'
what(): std::bad_alloc
